comments:
- Open Welcome
- Go to Tutorials
- Click "Deploy a feature on an update site"

It doesn't open and you get an error message saying it failed to create the cheatsheet part.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui.cheatsheets 4 0 2006-04-25 12:15:32.396
!MESSAGE The cheat sheet 'org.eclipse.pde.updates' does not exist. 

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui.intro 4 0 2006-04-25 12:15:32.406
!MESSAGE Failed to set the input: org.eclipse.pde.updates on standby part: org.eclipse.platform.cheatsheet
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.cheatsheets.views.CheatSheetViewer.readFile(CheatSheetViewer.java:937)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.cheatsheets.views.CheatSheetViewer.initCheatSheetView(CheatSheetViewer.java:806)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.cheatsheets.views.CheatSheetViewer.setContent(CheatSheetViewer.java:1071)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.cheatsheets.views.CheatSheetViewer.setInput(CheatSheetViewer.java:1119)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.cheatsheets.views.CheatSheetViewer.setInput(CheatSheetViewer.java:1094)
	at org.eclipse.platform.internal.CheatSheetStandbyContent.setInput(CheatSheetStandbyContent.java:76)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.intro.impl.parts.StandbyPart.setInput(StandbyPart.java:317)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.intro.impl.parts.StandbyPart.showContentPart(StandbyPart.java:239)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.intro.impl.model.url.IntroURL.handleStandbyState(IntroURL.java:243)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.intro.impl.model.url.IntroURL.doExecute(IntroURL.java:167)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.intro.impl.model.url.IntroURL$1.run(IntroURL.java:144)
Mike, was your cheatsheet supposed to include/replace this one? If so, we need to update the welcome links.

Mike, you should check all of the cheat sheets that can be launched from the Tutorials page of welcome to make sure the titles match those of the cheat sheets they launch. The button for "Create a Hello World plug-in" launches "Create an Eclipse plugin using PDE" which does a lot more than just Hello World.
As a meta-comment, should this code fail in such an ugly way? If the cheat sheet is missing, it should not fail with an NPE.
The UI shows an ok message, the exception only appears in the log.

Thanks for pointing out this oversight.

The old "Create an Eclipse plug-in using PDE" simple cheat sheet and
the old "Create a feature and an update site using PDE" simple cheat sheet
were both replaced by my new "Create an Eclipse plug-in using PDE" composite
cheat sheet.

The old "Create an RCP application using PDE" simple sheat sheet will be
replaced by my new "Create a RCP application using PDE" composite cheat 
sheet.

I plan to do the following on the "Tutorials" Welcome Page under the
"Eclipse Plug-in Development" heading:

* Rename hyper-link "Create a 'Hello, World' plug-in" to
  "Create an Eclipse plug-in"

  -> Update description as follows:
     "End-to-end tutorial demonstrating how to create a plug-in, 
      a plug-in extension, a feature, and an update site as well as 
      how to install and uninstall a feature"

* Delete hyper-link "Deploy a feature on an update site" along with its
  corresponding description

* Rename hyper-link "Build a Rich Client Platform application" to
  "Create a RCP application"

  -> Update description as follows:
     "End-to-end tutorial demonstrating how to create a plug-in, define a 
      plug-in based product, customize a product, export a RCP application 
      and define a feature based product"

Please let me know if you have any concerns.
Suggestions welcomed.

Mike, it is not common knowledge what RCP stands for.
Some people even think that RCP = Really Cozy Pillow or Really Chocolaty Pudding.

I suggest keeping RCP expanded to 'Rich Client Platform' in the link

Also it's not 'a RCP application', it's 'an RCP application'... in the description
I agree with Dejan, an NPE should not be logged in this case.  A nice Error dialog would be nice/sufficient here.

Fixed.

As per Wassim's corrections:

* Expanded "RCP" to "Rich Client Platform"

* Replaced instances of "a RCP" with "an RCP"

See Patch #1
